review: Absolutely love this thing. Was a gift for my husband for Christmas and he said it was very easy to hook up. Only complaint is that it's a pain to use with Hulu, but I think that's Hulu rather than Chromecast.
author: Jennifer E. Flint MacLean

review: The Chromecast does the job with respect to picture quality and works pretty well on the wifi in my home. However, I tried to use it in a NYC hotel and it would not access the wifi that was available. Also, it works with hulu, netflix, amazon and other streaming sites but does not offer other options for photos and other websites.
author: Ron the reader

review: I was online and on the phone with Google Chromecast support for over 5 hours trying to get this to even work. It found and recognized my WiFi, but refused to be linked to any of my devices, including our iPad 3, Nook HD and LG Android phone.Google's advice to me after going through the setup process almost a dozen times? Try buying ANOTHER device, "it may work then..." I returned it the next day. Got a new Blu-ray player instead for $30 bucks more. That machine's WiFi worked immediately and I had a lot more online content choices available.
author: chicagorob

review: Works as advertised, simple to set up, simple as that.  Just ordered a 2nd one!  Using IOS devices. Now if only Amazon Instant Video would add it!

review: Come on. How can you go wrong at $35?I was going to buy a smart TV as I wanted to watch Netflix on my TV, since my laptop is down but opted for this instead (for now..still need a bigger screen).This is a great device. Easy to setup and casting from your phone is simple and probably better than having to search using your remote.I'm having fun just making a TV playlist on YouTube and leaving it to play.I'd recommend to anyone.
